name: sometime
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
at a time in the future or the past that is not known or not stated: sometime before June We really should meet sometime soon to discuss the details. sometime in the autumn

Grammar
Sometimes or sometime?Sometimes means ‘not always or not often’: …
(especially of a job or position) in the past but not any longer: The new paper will be headed by Rebecca Jones, sometime editor of the "Daily News". Synonyms
erstwhile formal
former
old (FROM THE PAST)
a one-time teacher, doctor, cleaner, etc.

at a time in the future or the past which is not known or stated: I’m having lunch with an old friend sometime next week.
